001/*

004 */
005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
011
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyAtomicItem;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
015
016import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLEventReader2;
017import org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamWriter2;
018import org.codehaus.stax2.evt.XMLEventFactory2;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.lang.reflect.Field;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.function.Supplier;
024
025import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
026import javax.xml.stream.XMLEventWriter;
027import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException;
028import javax.xml.stream.events.StartElement;
029import javax.xml.stream.events.XMLEvent;
030
031import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
032
033public interface IDataTypeAdapter<TYPE> {
034
035  /**
036   * Get the metaschema type names associated with this adapter. This name must be
037   * unique with respect to all other metaschema types.
038   * <p>
039   * At least one name must be provided, with the first name being the most
040   * preferred name.
041   *
042   * @return the name
043   */
044  @NonNull
045  List<QName> getNames();
046
047  /**
048   * Get the most preferred name for this data type.
049   *
050   * @return the name
051   */
052  @NonNull
053  default QName getPreferredName() {
054    return ObjectUtils.notNull(getNames().iterator().next());
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * The JSON primative type of the data type.
059   *
060   * @return the JSON data type
061   */
062  JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType();
063
064  /**
065   * Get the Java class supported by this adapter.
066   *
067   * @return the Java class
068   */
069  @NonNull
070  Class<TYPE> getJavaClass();
071
072  /**
073   * Casts the provided value to the type associated with this adapter.
074   *
075   * @param value
076   *          a value of the provided type
077   * @return the typed value
078   */
079  @NonNull
080  TYPE toValue(@NonNull Object value);
081
082  /**
083   * Gets the value as a string suitable for writing as text. This is intended for
084   * data types that have a simple string-based structure in XML and JSON, such as
085   * for XML attributes or JSON keys. An adapter for a complex data structures
086   * that consist of XML elements will throw an
087   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} when this is called.
088   *
089   * @param value
090   *          the data to formatted as a string
091   * @return a string
092   * @throws UnsupportedOperationException
093   *           if the data type cannot be represented as a string
094   */
095  @NonNull
096  String asString(@NonNull Object value);
097
098  /**
099   * Create a copy of the provided value.
100   *
101   * @param obj
102   *          the value to copy
103   * @return the copy
104   */
105  @NonNull
106  TYPE copy(@NonNull Object obj);
107
108  /**
109   * Determines if the data type is an atomic, scalar value. Complex structures
110   * such as Markup are not considered atomic.
111   *
112   * @return {@code true} if the data type is an atomic scalar value, or
113   *         {@code false} otherwise
114   */
115  default boolean isAtomic() {
116    return true;
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Get the java type of the associated item.
121   *
122   * @return the java associated item type
123   */
124  @NonNull
125  Class<? extends IAnyAtomicItem> getItemClass();
126
127  /**
128   * Construct a new item of this type using the provided value.
129   *
130   * @param value
131   *          the item's value
132   * @return a new item
133   */
134  // TODO: markup types are not atomic values. Figure out a better base type
135  // (i.e., IValuedItem)
136  @NonNull
137  IAnyAtomicItem newItem(@NonNull Object value);
138
139  /**
140   * Cast the provided item to an item of this type, if possible.
141   *
142   * @param item
143   *          the atomic item to cast
144   * @return an atomic item of this type
145   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
146   *           if the provided item type cannot be cast to this item type
147   */
148  @NonNull
149  IAnyAtomicItem cast(IAnyAtomicItem item);
150
151  /**
152   * Indicates if the adapter will parse the {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} before
153   * parsing the value data.
154   *
155   * @return {@code true} if the adapter requires the start element for parsing,
156   *         or {@code false} otherwise
157   */
158  // TODO; implement or remove this
159  boolean isParsingStartElement();
160
161  /**
162   * Determines if adapter can parse the next element. The next element's
163   * {@link QName} is provided for this purpose.
164   * <p>
165   * This will be called when the parser encounter's an element it does not
166   * recognize. This gives the adapter a chance to request parsing of the data.
167   *
168   * @param nextElementQName
169   *          the next element's namespace-qualified name
170   * @return {@code true} if the adapter will parse the element, or {@code false}
171   *         otherwise
172   */
173  boolean canHandleQName(@NonNull QName nextElementQName);
174
175  /**
176   * Parses a provided string. Used to parse XML attributes, simple XML character
177   * data, and JSON/YAML property values.
178   *
179   * @param value
180   *          the string value to parse
181   * @return the parsed data as the adapter's type
182   * @throws IllegalArgumentException
183   *           if the data is not valid to the data type
184   */
185  @NonNull
186  TYPE parse(@NonNull String value);
187
188  /**
189   * This method is expected to parse content starting at the next event. Parsing
190   * will continue until the next event represents content that is not handled by
191   * this adapter. This means the event stream should be positioned after any
192   * {@link XMLEvent#END_ELEMENT} that corresponds to an
193   * {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} parsed by this adapter.
194   * <p>
195   * If {@link #isParsingStartElement()} returns {@code true}, then the first
196   * event to parse will be the {@link XMLEvent#START_ELEMENT} for the element
197   * that contains the value data, then the value data. If this is the case, this
198   * method must also parse the corresponding {@link XMLEvent#END_ELEMENT}.
199   * Otherwise, the first event to parse will be the value data.
200   * <p>
201   * The value data is expected to be parsed completely, leaving the event stream
202   * on a peeked event corresponding to content that is not handled by this
203   * method.
204   *
205   * @param eventReader
206   *          the XML parser used to read the parsed value
207   * @return the parsed value
208   * @throws IOException
209   *           if a parsing error occurs
210   */
211  @NonNull
212  TYPE parse(@NonNull XMLEventReader2 eventReader) throws IOException;
213
214  /**
215   * Parses a JSON property value.
216   *
217   * @param parser
218   *          the JSON parser used to read the parsed value
219   * @return the parsed value
220   * @throws IOException
221   *           if a parsing error occurs
222   */
223  @NonNull
224  TYPE parse(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException;
225
226  /**
227   * Parses a provided string using {@link #parse(String)}.
228   * <p>
229   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
230   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
231   *
232   * @param value
233   *          the string value to parse
234   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
235   * @throws IOException
236   *           if an error occurs while parsing
237   * @see #parse(String)
238   */
239  @NonNull
240  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull String value) throws IOException {
241    TYPE retval = parse(value);
242    return () -> copy(retval);
243  }
244
245  /**
246   * Parses a provided string using
247   * {@link IDataTypeAdapter#parse(XMLEventReader2)}.
248   * <p>
249   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
250   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
251   *
252   * @param eventReader
253   *          the XML parser used to read the parsed value
254   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
255   * @throws IOException
256   *           if an error occurs while parsing
257   * @see #parse(String)
258   * @see #parse(XMLEventReader2)
259   */
260  @NonNull
261  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull XMLEventReader2 eventReader) throws IOException {
262    TYPE retval = parse(eventReader);
263    return () -> copy(retval);
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Parses a provided string using {@link #parse(JsonParser)}.
268   * <p>
269   * This method may pre-parse the data and then return copies, since the data can
270   * only be parsed once, but the supplier might be called multiple times.
271   *
272   * @param parser
273   *          the JSON parser used to read the parsed value
274   * @return a supplier that will provide new instances of the parsed data
275   * @throws IOException
276   *           if an error occurs while parsing
277   * @see #parse(String)
278   * @see #parse(JsonParser)
279   */
280  @NonNull
281  default Supplier<TYPE> parseAndSupply(@NonNull JsonParser parser) throws IOException {
282    TYPE retval = parse(parser);
283    return () -> copy(retval);
284  }
285
286  /**
287   * Writes the provided Java class instance data as XML. The parent element
288   * information is provided as a {@link StartElement} event, which allows
289   * namespace information to be obtained from the parent element using the
290   * {@link StartElement#getName()} and {@link StartElement#getNamespaceContext()}
291   * methods, which can be used when writing the provided instance value.
292   *
293   * @param instance
294   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
295   * @param parent
296   *          the {@link StartElement} XML event that is the parent of the data to
297   *          write
298   * @param eventFactory
299   *          the XML event factory used to generate XML writing events
300   * @param eventWriter
301   *          the XML writer used to output XML as events
302   * @throws XMLStreamException
303   *           if an unexpected error occurred while processing the XML output
304   * @throws IOException
305   *           if an unexpected error occurred while writing to the output stream
306   */
307  void writeXmlValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull StartElement parent, @NonNull XMLEventFactory2 eventFactory,
308      @NonNull XMLEventWriter eventWriter)
309      throws IOException, XMLStreamException;
310
311  /**
312   * Writes the provided Java class instance data as XML. The parent element
313   * information is provided as an XML {@link QName}, which allows namespace
314   * information to be obtained from the parent element. Additional namespace
315   * information can be gathered using the
316   * {@link XMLStreamWriter2#getNamespaceContext()} method, which can be used when
317   * writing the provided instance value.
318   *
319   * @param instance
320   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
321   * @param parentName
322   *          the qualified name of the XML data's parent element
323   * @param writer
324   *          the XML writer used to output the XML data
325   * @throws XMLStreamException
326   *           if an unexpected error occurred while processing the XML output
327   */
328  void writeXmlValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull QName parentName, @NonNull XMLStreamWriter2 writer)
329      throws XMLStreamException;
330
331  /**
332   * Writes the provided Java class instance as a JSON/YAML field value.
333   *
334   * @param instance
335   *          the {@link Field} instance value to write
336   * @param writer
337   *          the JSON/YAML writer used to output the JSON/YAML data
338   * @throws IOException
339   *           if an unexpected error occurred while writing the JSON/YAML output
340   */
341  void writeJsonValue(@NonNull Object instance, @NonNull JsonGenerator writer) throws IOException;
342
343  /**
344   * Gets the default value to use as the JSON/YAML field name for a Metaschema
345   * field value if no JSON value key flag or name is configured.
346   *
347   * @return the default field name to use
348   */
349  @NonNull
350  String getDefaultJsonValueKey();
351
352  /**
353   * Determines if the data type's value is allowed to be unwrapped in XML when
354   * the value is a field value.
355   *
356   * @return {@code true} if allowed, or {@code false} otherwise.
357   */
358  boolean isUnrappedValueAllowedInXml();
359
360  /**
361   * Determines if the datatype uses mixed text and element content in XML.
362   *
363   * @return {@code true} if the datatype uses mixed text and element content in
364   *         XML, or {@code false} otherwise
365   */
366  boolean isXmlMixed();
367}
